meanings.definition: A yard or burial ground surrounding a church.
meanings.sent1: The churchyard was peaceful and quiet, with old gravestones scattered around.
meanings.sent2: People often visit the churchyard to pay their respects to loved ones who have passed away.
meanings.sent3: The churchyard was so full of history, even the ghosts had stories to tell.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the churchyard seemed to come alive with whispers of the past.
meanings.sent5: Walking through the churchyard felt like stepping back in time, surrounded by memories of those who came before.

meanings.definition: The area of land around a church.
meanings.sent1: The churchyard was filled with colorful flowers and chirping birds.
meanings.sent2: Children played tag in the churchyard, their laughter echoing through the trees.
meanings.sent3: During the summer picnic, the churchyard became a lively gathering place for the whole community.
meanings.sent4: The churchyard was a sanctuary of peace amidst the bustling city streets.
meanings.sent5: The churchyard was a place of solace and reflection, away from the chaos of everyday life.
